com.bluegosling.util

Interface Hasher<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of object that is hashed

    public interface Hasher<T>
    Allows adding/overriding hashCode and equals behavior for an object. The hasher provides alternate computations for these operations than the original object. You can then wrap the object using wrap(Class, Object). The wrapped result uses the hasher's behavior for implementing hashCode and equals, and the original value can be extracted via the resulting object's get method.

    • Method Detail

      • hashCode

        int hashCode(T val)
        Computes a hash code for the given value.

      • equals

        boolean equals(T val1,
               T val2)
        Determines if the given two objects are equal.
        Parameters:
        val1 - a value
        val2 - another value
        Returns:
        true if the objects are considered equal

      • wrap

        default <U extends T> Supplier<U> wrap(Class<U> type,
                                       U value)
        Returns a hashing wrapper for the given object. The value supplied by the wrapper is the original value (the given object). The returned object uses this hasher's equals(Object, Object) and hashCode(Object) methods to implements its own equals and hashCode methods.

        The returned object's implementation of equals will return false if given any object that cannot be cast to the given type token.

        Parameters:
        type - the type of values that can be equal to the given value
        value - a value
        Returns:
        a wrapper that uses this hasher to implement hashCode and equals

      • wrapperForType

        default <U extends T> Function<U,Supplier<U>> wrapperForType(Class<U> type)
        Returns a function that can be applied to any object to return a hashing wrapper for that object. This effectively "curries" the type token which can simplify downstream usages of the hasher.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of values that can be equal to the given value
        Returns:
        a function that returns hashing wrappers for the arguments given to it

      • forFields

        @SafeVarargs
static <T> Hasher<T> forFields(Function<? super T,?>... fieldAccessors)
        Returns a hasher that uses the given functions to extract field values. The field values are then used to implement both hashCode and equals.
        Parameters:
        fieldAccessors - function for accessing the fields that should be inputs to hashCode and equals operations
        Returns:
        a hasher that uses the given functions to extract field values

      • forFields

        static <T> Hasher<T> forFields(List<? extends Function<? super T,?>> fieldAccessors)
        Returns a hasher that uses the given functions to extract field values. The field values are then used to implement both hashCode and equals.
        Parameters:
        fieldAccessors - function for accessing the fields that should be inputs to hashCode and equals operations
        Returns:
        a hasher that uses the given functions to extract field values

      • of

        static <T> Hasher<T> of(ToIntFunction<? super T> hashCode,
                        BiPredicate<? super T,? super T> equals)
        Returns a hasher that composes the given functional interfaces to implement hashCode and equals.
        Parameters:
        hashCode - a function that computes hash codes
        equals - a predicate that tests whether two values are equal
        Returns:
        a hasher that composes the given function interfaces
